topic: Deep dive: _sha2 standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _sha2 standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: _sha2 Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a comprehensive overview of the new features and improvements in Python's _sha2 standard library module, introduced in version 3.12.
key_points: _sha2 offers improved performance over previous hash functions in Python
_sha2 supports both SHA-256 and SHA-512 cryptographic hashing algorithms
New features include support for parallel processing, which can significantly speed up computations
_sha2 now provides a more user-friendly API compared to previous implementations
version_notes: Previously known as hashlib.new('sha256') or hashlib.new('sha512')
caveats: _sha2 does not support any SHA-1 algorithms, and it is strongly recommended to use more secure SHA-256 or SHA-512
